Entries.default:
"Greetings, stranger! Ekera, aren't you the dangerous-looking sort?"

The aumaua woman smiles warmly, revealing sharp teeth.
"You return? Perhaps then you stay interested in my wares?"

"I have all sorts of fine magical items. Will save your life in the pit, as sure as Ngati's thrashing stirs the sea!"

Her hand indicates the trinkets in the stall behind her with a fluid, sweeping gesture.
"Let me see what you have."
[Leave.] "Maybe another time."

"Always the finest items."

She turns to show you her inventory.
"Perhaps later."

"Of course, always later."

Scowling, she crosses her arms.
"Oh, we've already stacked as many jars of eel jelly as our packs can hold. Appreciate the offer."
"It is possible they are magical. Animancers have found the Huana possess their own powerful techniques for binding essence."

"On your way, then."

She shoos you with a flap of one large, reddish hand.
"I seem to have hit a sore spot. Having trouble selling your goods?"
"On second thought, let's see what you've got."
"Maybe you should be a bit more polite to your client√®le."
[Ignore the woman and keep walking.]
Face reddening, the aumaua glances away.
Face reddening, the aumaua glances away.
Face reddening, the aumaua glances away.

"Always all of the fighting sort go across the way. I say it is not fair."

She points towards a heavy door on the far side of the pool of water in the center of the structure.

"Ekera, many apologies. Don't mind me, always blunting my teeth."

She turns away.

"The best things lost to the Crucible, they always are going to Engari across the way. Special rewards, for the contestants. I stay getting the cast-offs, like Roparu."

She sighs and rubs her brow.
"Why is that?"
"Anything I can do to help?"
"Maybe if you were more polite they'd come to you."
[Leave] "Farewell."

"Maybe, ekera."

Eyes narrowed, she turns from you.

"Stay browsing and buy something?" 

She snorts.
"For what do you tarry on the fringe of the Crucible? Go and get your hands dirty!"
"One day I will boast that I knew you as a humble challenger. What would you like in the meantime?" Winge folds her arms and nods to her goods.
"I admit to underestimating you, contender. I say I will not make the same mistake twice." Winge gives you a friendly jab with her elbow.
"You slayed that great beast! What can there be for you among my humble offerings?"
"Champion. If you need something to hurl at your next wave of foes, look no further." Winge chuckles and steps aside to show you her wares.
"One chosen by the Faces must fight to maintain their good standing. You need something from me, then?"
"What'd ya do? She's not usually like this." Konstanten cuts you a suspicious glare.
"It seems your remark struck deeper than intended, Watcher."
"Well, dang, Watcher. Seems like you rattled her cage something fierce."
"Have we said something to offend? Forgive me, I say... I am not accustomed to seeing a lady disappointed."
"I barely trade enough to survive, much less prosper."
"Can't hurt to look, can it?"

"Yes, Duskspeaker. Let us discard our coin in trade for this detritus."

Vatnir picks up one of the aumaua's baubles and examines it briefly before dropping it back upon her piled goods.
Winge's nostrils flare at Vatnir, her upper lip curling over sharp, triangular teeth.
"Well, Hel, Vatnir, you ain't got to be hard-hearted about it."
"But who am I to push away business?" Winge gestures toward her goods.
